title: Rigatoni With Salami, Mozzarella And Arugula
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Rigatoni With Salami, Mozzarellan And Arugulan a try. One serving contains 247 calories, 6g of protein, and 6g of fat. This recipe serves 30. For $2.54 per serving, this recipe covers 6% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of salami, olive oil, pecorino   romano cheese, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. 2 people were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 29 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 24%, this dish is not so awesome. Try Rigatoni With Spicy Salami And Tomato, Rigatoni with Salami and Red Wine Sauce, and Mozzarella & salami ciabatta for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
